ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Very well taught class. Highly recommended for new imaging students

Good class but be prepared to be doing psets constantly. If this class had half the work load, its usefulness would increase exponentially as students would have time to actually understand material at a reasonable pace.

This course covers all the biosensing methods available. Biosenors and imaging modalities are considered in significant detail. I would recommend this course to BME's who intend to design biosensors or who have a focus in imaging. I do not think the current design of the class is all that relevant to all the BME students.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: New to imaging. This was a great introduction class.
Explained some of the physics behind techniques that I use in my thesis work (i.e FRET).
Yes, my knowledge of bioimaging and biosenors deepened. It only somewhat helps my PhD research. Possible could help more down the road.
